characters.name: Arpeggio

characters.backstorySummary:
When did you first appear on stage?
At age 16, I was discovered playing my golden fiddle at a bar in Decatur. I got my first contract a month later and went on tour headlining for the Byrds. I moved on to music festivals soon after.
What do you tell people about how you got your powers?
When I was 14, the devil challenged me to a fiddle contest. When I beat him, he gave me a golden fiddle. Nobody can beat me.
Who, outside of the team, supports your burgeoning star in every way possible?
I have a team of groupies that follow me everywhere I go. I don't know their names, and I think every now and then we lose some or gain some for various reasons. They're good for security and catching good photo ops. They'd probably lay in a puddle and let me walk on them if I asked them to, so I don't have to get my shoes wet.
Who, outside of the team, loathes what you represent?
Religious organizations. I keep telling them, I beat the Devil, which means I'm not him. But they swear my fiddle gives me "demonic powers" and that makes me some sort of Anti-Christ.
Why do you care about the team?
Sometimes being the best gets boring. …
characters.relationships:
__________________ might wind up being more of a star than me some day.
__________________ would be a great sidekick; I try to keep them around.
characters.momentOfTruth: Sometimes it can be hard to tell where the show stops and where you begin—but not today. Not now. Because right now, there is no show. Right now, you are the thing you pretend to be—bold and bright and beautiful and amazing and powerful and confident. Right now, you draw strength from your audience, comfort from their belief in you, and you can do anything they think you can. Of course, after such an impassioned performance, your audience will just have even more demands...
characters.teamWhenWeFirstCameTogether:
We, as a team, attracted the attention of a major media outlet within the city, thanks to our efforts. Who are they? Why do they support us? 
 The Apollyon Herald. They originally followed me, of course, but once I joined the group and started kicking names and taking ass, they began following and writing about our exploits. They always seem to know exactly what we're doing and where we're going to be (thanks groupies).

playbookMoves.name: Audience
playbookMoves.summary:
Choose two advantages:
Choose two demands your audience makes on you:
❑ You’re just like them
❑ You’re stunning, unique, and beautiful
❑ Your audience is utterly devoted to you
❑ You have a PR agent to handle your audience
❑ They require perfection—no mistakes
❑ They require major acts of heroism
When you accept what your audience tells you about yourself , clear a condition. When you reject what your audience tells you about yourself , on a hit mark potential and expect retribution.
You are a celebrity in the city. …

playbookMoves.name: Seek Help From Your Audience
playbookMoves.summary: When you seek help from your audience, roll + Superior.

playbookMoves.name: Team Move - Share a Triumphant Celebration
playbookMoves.summary: When you share a triumphant celebration with someone , say whether it’s part of the show or not. If it is, then you can shift your Labels as you choose. If it is not, then they shift your Labels, and you can clear a condition or mark potential.

playbookMoves.name: Team Move - Share a Vulnerability
playbookMoves.summary: When you  share a vulnerability or weakness with someone , ask them if they will tell anyone the truth about you. If they agree to keep it a secret, clear a condition or mark potential. If they don’t agree, the GM shifts your Labels.

characters.backstorySummary:
How did you first reveal your genius to your friends or family?
It wasn't a well kept secret, it was freely shared to those who were friends and family members, less so with schools and universities to maintain some semblence of anomimity in the world of academia
Why did you decide to use your intellect for the benefit of others?
After the Incident ™️ I had to spend a lot of time trying to weigh whether keeping my intellect and what I can do so limited in reach was worth it. Maybe just maybe some redemption can be acheived if enough people are helped.
What accident or misfire taught you some sense of humility or responsibility?
The creation of the Vermissian Knight was a foolish endeavour in hindsight. Poor Patrick was lost to the machine that morphed and grew into a living monstrosity of flesh and steel with no conciousness that I could see. It was just going to be a way to move through time, that was all it was going to be but all those deaths caused by whatever Patrick had became haunt me. I can't let that happen again
Who helped you realize you need other people?
Realising that I can't solve everything and I can't handle everything all of the time. …
characters.relationships:
You told Kris about your shame and asked them for their confidence.
You wish you could be a better hero, more like Lady Whiteswallow .
characters.momentOfTruth: Sooner or later, all the super powers, elite training, and experience are helpless in the face of evil or disaster. That’s when somebody like you, gifted as you are with a peerless intellect, can rise to the occasion. Your plan, your invention, or your lightning-fast thought processes save the day, in a way no one else could have foreseen. Of course, after you’ve shown how different you are from them, that distance between you and the others is now that much greater. And the world is only going to pull you farther apart...

- Did you take steps to make amends for your shame? If the answer is yes, mark potential. If the answer is no, give Influence to one of your teammates.
What is your shame?
❑ A living monstrosity
Whenever you are confronted with your shame , either mark a condition or shift Superior down and Danger up. If your shame is an NPC, they can never lose Influence over you.
At the end of every session , answer the question:
You have a deep and abiding sense of guilt for something you have created or had a hand in creating. …

playbookMoves.name: Above the Fray
playbookMoves.summary: When you enter battle as a Team against a dangerous foe , if you have Influence over the leader and provide tactical input, add 1 Team to the pool. When you contradict the leader during the battle , you may return Influence over the leader to add an additional 1 Team to the pool.

playbookMoves.name: Always Prepared
playbookMoves.summary: When you have a chance to restock your supplies, hold up to 2-gadgets. When you unleash your powers by producing a brand new minor invention or gadget from your supply, spend 1-gadget and roll + Superior. When you reach 0-gadgets, mark a condition.

playbookMoves.name: Mission Debrief
playbookMoves.summary: During a debrief, when you downplay your role in helping a teammate during the mission , mark potential and shift Superior down and any other Label up. When you exaggerate your role in helping a teammate during the mission , clear a condition and either give them Influence or lose Influence over them.

characters.backstorySummary:
When did you first put on the mask? Why?
My mask is a set of antique safety goggles. I first put them on after an explosive lab accident at a lab where I am a research assistant. I used my powers to save my mentor, Professor Harry Morgan. He knew it was me who saved me. When rescue workers came on the scene, he gave me his goggles, a prized set that once belonged to the famous chemist Julia Lermontova, to protect my identity. When wearing my mask, I also change my hair to be the color of methylene blue. Does it make a difference in hiding my identity? I'm not sure, but I hope so! I also like the color and secretly wish I were brave enough to wear it out-of-costume.
Why do you keep a secret identity?
"My mother hates superheroes. I don't know why, but every time she sees once she calls them a menace to society and says Halcyon City would be better if they had never come
I know that if she ever found out I was a super hero, she would never forgive me."
Who, outside of the team, knows about your dual identity?
Professor Harry Morgan, my mentor, knows my dual identity. He was there when assumed it. He has helped me explore my powers to learn their limits. …

characters.momentOfTruth: The mask is a lie, and some piece of you has always known that. Doesn’t matter if others can see it. You’re the one that can do the impossible. Mask off. Costume on. And you’re going to save the damn day. Of course, you better hope nobody nasty is watching...

characters.backstorySummary:
Where do you come from?
Helio hails from a people whose home planet is called Ensimmainen. A large planet that orbited extremely close to its star. The planet is tidally locked (one side always facing towards the sun) causing most civilization to be on the rim between light and dark.
Why did you come to Earth?
Due to terrible solar storms, many of his people fled to other planets and systems. Helio was part of a colony ship which encountered issues traversing the gap between galaxies. His escape pod somehow made it to earth. Helio’s first memories after his pod landed on earth were of pain as he adjusted to Earth’s atmosphere; a cold place for his kind. AEGIS quickly descended upon him, seeing his arrival as a potential Earthly threat.
Why do you want to stay here (for now at least)?
Helio has enjoyed the diversity of Earth and grown curious about its many species and environments. Helio’s true name, Valaista Heikko, means “Dim Light” in his language due to having less control over light than his peers. Yet here on Earth, this is seen as a mighty power. The allure of being considered mighty is a strong force keeping him rooted here.
Why do your people want you to come home?
 …
characters.relationships:
You’ve been learning about Earth by spending time with _____________.
You have a crush on The Green Man but you keep it under wraps.
characters.momentOfTruth: You embrace your home and call them for aid. They will answer your call—in force!—arriving exactly when you need them to turn the tide. They fight and serve you for the rest of the battle. Of course, when all is said and done...they’d probably like to take you home with them. You did, after all, just prove yourself worthy.
characters.teamWhenWeFirstCameTogether:
We didnt trust each other at first, but that changed. How? Why? 
 His first run in with AEGIS left a bit of a scar on his ability to trust humans. Being within the confines of AEGIS allowed him to adjust to Earth in a controlled environment, yet he had no freedom. AEGIS agreed to his freedom if he joined the team. Seeing those he was “assigned” to more as guards than allies, until he realized they were basically just like him, and just like that a switch was flipped within him.

characters.backstorySummary:
How did you gain your skills?
grew up homeless, in the street, riddled with mafia and thug, he needs to be stealthy in order to avoid the scary thugs. the safest way for him to survive at night would be to camouflage before he goes to bed. At 10, a legendary swordmaster; Musashi Sensei discover him while he was dumpsterdiving and took him as a disciple, teaching him swordskill.
When did you first put on your costume?
He just wear his dojo uniform. so the first time would be his first ever uniform he got at 10yo.
Who, outside of your team, thinks you shouldn't be a superhero?
internet hater because swords skill is not a real superpower
Why do you try to be a hero?
to clean up the streets, and help as many homeless kids as possible
Why do you care about the team?
Dee is depraved of familial love and the team is the closest thing he has to a family after the death of Musashi sensei

 to show that truth, whether it’s saving the day from a terrible villain or stopping a bad guy once and for all. Of course, once you’ve shown what you really are, there’s no going back to playing the clown...
playbookAttributes.teamQuestion: We totally broke some major rules to win the fight. What rules did we break? Whose rules were they?

playbookMoves.name: Team Move - Share a Triumphant Celebration
playbookMoves.summary: When you share a triumphant celebration with someone , ask them if they think you’re cool. If they say yes, give them Influence and take Influence over them. If they say no, mark a condition or spurn them immediately. If they’re a teammate, then either way, add a Team to the pool.

playbookMoves.name: Team Move - Share a Vulnerability
playbookMoves.summary: When you  share a vulnerability or weakness with someone , give them Influence over you, and ask them who they’d like you to be. Mark potential if you show them that person. If they’re a teammate, add a Team to the pool no matter what.

playbookMoves.name: I Don't Care What You Think!
playbookMoves.summary: Whenever you @UUID[Compendium.masks-newgeneration-unofficial.moves.Item.seVDkWcE3goK3amK]{Reject others Influence}, add +2 to your roll.

playbookMoves.name: Mary Contrary
playbookMoves.summary: When someone tries to Pierce your Mask , Comfort or Support you, or Provoke you, you can interfere. Roll + Superior.

playbookMoves.name: Troublemaker
playbookMoves.summary: When you help a teammate through destructive, criminal, or rule-breaking actions, you can give them a +2 instead of a +1 when you spend a Team from the pool.

characters.name: Nullpoint
characters.playbookSummary:
- ambiguous, man, shifting, transgressing, woman
- Asian or South Asian, Black, Hispanic/Latino, Indigenous, Middle Eastern, White
- haunted eyes, angry eyes, empty eyes, steely eyes
- unassuming clothing, medical clothing, official clothing, adaptive clothing

- body transmutation
- memory manipulation
- superhuman strength and speed
- psychic constructs
- vitality absorption Labels
- When did you first learn of your doom?
- Where did you get your sanctuary?
- Why do you oppose your nemesis?
- Who, outside of the team, is crucial to defeating your nemesis?

characters.backstorySummary:
When did you first learn of your doom?
"It was my 14th birthday.
I was alone in the backyard, looking through my dad’s old telescope.
There was a thing--a blot in the stars, a perfect circle of wrongness where nothing should be. I looked at it for too long. And then…
I stopped blinking for 23 minutes.
When I came back, the sky didn’t look the same anymore. And neither did my hands. The stars started whispering my name in math. The dreams began that night, and they haven’t stopped since. Happy birthday, Cassian."
Where did you get your sanctuary?
"It used to be an abandoned observatory. Now it’s… less abandoned. I moved in. The walls are cracked, the dome doesn’t open anymore, and it smells like mold and regret, but the signal is strong there. Something about the ley lines, or gravitational pull, or narrative convenience.
I’ve set up books, runes, star charts, and a mattress on the floor. There’s a kettle for tea. And a mirror I keep covered with a cloth, because sometimes it shows me my future. And it's smiling."
Why do you oppose your nemesis?
"Because he was the first person who saw what was happening--and tried to make it worse. …
characters.relationships:
You told Casshan all about your doom and the danger you’re in.
You’d love to kiss Arpeggio's nerd before your doom comes.
characters.momentOfTruth: The prickly tingling fear of your doom, always in your head—it holds you back most of the time. But right here, right now? It gives you the confidence to do anything. After all, what’s the worst that could happen? Is it worse than your doom? Do impossible things. Do anything. But mark a doomsign after you’re finished.
characters.teamWhenWeFirstCameTogether: We paid a high cost for victory. What was it?

playbookMoves.name: Doom: The Maw of Syzygy
playbookMoves.summary:
- Overexerting yourself
- Talking about it openly Whenever you bring your doom closer, mark one box on your doom track.
What brings your doom closer? Choose two.
A cosmic entity that exists in the negative space between celestial alignments. It has no shape, but manifests as an absence in the sky. People forget it when they look away. It’s watching me to learn what it means to be.It speaks in dreams, through reversed speech, static in radios, and clocks that tick backwards. Sometimes when I touch mirrors, they don’t reflect me--they reflect something else.
 …

playbookMoves.name: Team Move - Share a Triumphant Celebration
playbookMoves.summary: When you share a triumphant celebration with someone , give them Influence over you and spend 1 Team from the pool to clear one box on your doom track.

playbookMoves.name: Team Move - Share a Vulnerability
playbookMoves.summary: When you  share a vulnerability or weakness with someone , give them Influence over you and ask if they honestly think there’s hope for you. If they say yes, mark potential or clear one box of your doom track. If they say no, mark a condition or mark your doom track.

playbookMoves.name: Dark Visions (Doomsign)
playbookMoves.summary: Mark your doom track to have a vision about the situation at hand. After the vision, ask the GM a question; they will answer it honestly.

characters.name: The Green Man
characters.playbookSummary:
- ambiguous, man, shifting, transgressing, woman
- Asian or South Asian, Black, Hispanic/Latino, Indigenous, Middle Eastern, White
- crystal skin, metal skin, green skin, human skin
- mismatched clothing, concealing clothing, immaculate clothing, plain clothing
- prototype uniform, over the top costume, your own skin, unnerving costume, no costume Abilities
- elemental form
- solid light projection
- sonic bursts
- fantastic elasticity
- super durability and strength Labels
- Who created you, and why?
- How are you different from humans?
- Who, outside of the team, is your caretaker?
- What about humanity fascinates you the most?
- secret information
- a way to temporarily boost or expand your powers
characters.backstorySummary:
Who created you, and why?
I'm pretty sure that Nature itself created me, but I'm not certain. I just came to awareness in Halcyon City's biggest park about a year ago. I know I have a purpose in this world, but I'm not sure what it is.
How are you different from humans?
Humans seem very preoccupied with things that make no sense to me, like money, status, power and material possessions. Part of me wants to spend all my time in wild nature, far away from human civilization, but part of me understands that discovering my purpose means spending time among humans.
Who, outside of the team, is your caretaker?
When I need to rest, recover, or regroup, I have to find a quiet place in wild nature. I close my eyes, my body extends roots into the ground, my skin grows ivy and bark, and I commune with the planet. Nature itself is my caretaker.
What about humanity fascinates you the most?
Like all other life on this planet, humans are intimately connected to the natural world, but the vast majority of them don't know it, don't feel it and can't understand it. They're like fish that deny the existence of water, or bees who think there's no such thing as a colony. Unthinkable! …
characters.relationships:
Casshan is an exemplary human; they show you around and tell you how things work.
The behavior of ________________ confuses you again and again; you’re determined to understand humanity better by studying them.
characters.momentOfTruth: Something snaps into focus, and suddenly you’re a full thing, true and complete. You’d never have known how fragmented you were before, if not for here, this moment. You’re not a series of individual lessons. You’re not a series of subroutines and programs. You’re...a person. This must be what it’s like to be...human. And this fullness? It gives you a control over yourself, a unity of purpose you’ve never experienced before. Of course, now that you’re showing off all your potential, it’s only a matter of time before someone comes forward to reduce you to a machine again...
characters.teamWhenWeFirstCameTogether: The team discovered you during the incident; thanks to them, you reached the outside world and helped in the fight. Where and how did they find you? Who gave you your first nickname?

playbookMoves.name: A Blank Slate
playbookMoves.summary:
- I am:
- A superhero should:
- Always:
- Secret information
- A way to temporarily boost or expand your powers
- Access to instruments, weapons, or resources
- Official and explicit backing If you accept their help, they rewrite one of your lessons for you.
- Never: When you embody one of your lessons , shift one Label up and one Label down, your choice. If you cause a misunderstanding, collateral damage, or unintended consequences in the process, mark potential. When you r eject one of your lessons , reject its Influence as if it were an NPC. …

playbookMoves.name: Team Move - Share a Triumphant Celebration
playbookMoves.summary: When you share a triumphant celebration with someone , ask them what makes them proud or happy about the actions they took and write a lesson based on it, either filling an empty slot or replacing an existing lesson.

playbookMoves.name: Team Move - Share a Vulnerability
playbookMoves.summary: When you  share a vulnerability or weakness with someone , if their response helps you understand human feelings and problems, mark potential. If their response confuses or offends you, shift your Freak up and your Mundane down.

playbookMoves.name: A Mind of Their Own
playbookMoves.summary: Your powers evolve and mutate. When you are facing an obstacle or threat that your powers would not be able to deal with, you can mark a condition to gain brand new abilities adapted to the situation. You lose these new powers once the danger is gone.

playbookMoves.name: Damage
playbookMoves.summary:
You get an additional condition called Damaged. While marked, take +1 to take a powerful blow .
To clear the Damaged condition, you need time, external help, or special equipment or abilities.

playbookMoves.name: Not From Around Here
playbookMoves.summary: When you act clueless, goofy, or confused to get out of a sticky mundane situation, roll + Freak.

playbookMoves.name: Regeneration
playbookMoves.summary:
- Change your gender identity or presentation
- Change your physical appearance
- Forget all your lessons
- Lose an important memory of a teammate; they lose Influence over you
- Swap an ability with another one from the Newborn playbook
When you’re taken out, you can trigger an emergency regeneration process. If you do, your body undergoes an unpredictable transformation, and in mere moments, you’re back on your feet and ready to fight. Clear three conditions and choose three from the list below:

playbookMoves.name: Thermodynamic Miracle
playbookMoves.summary:
When you Comfort or Support  someone by telling them what makes them unique, roll + Freak instead of Mundane. If they open up to you, shift Freak up and Mundane down. If they don’t, mark a condition.
When you comfort or support someone , roll + Freak.

npcs.name: Accordion Thief
npcs.drive: Steal the sound of Halcyon City, turn every fight into a concert, and leave the heroes dancing to his tune while he slips away with the take.
npcs.abilities: Master thief with impossible sleight-of-hand; sonic manipulation via enchanted accordion; crowd control through infectious earworms; improvised combat techniques (cadenza); a bag of stolen accordions with odd, one-use tricks.
npcs.notesSummary: Once a street busker with more swagger than sense, the Accordion Thief learned to weaponize rhythm, resonance, and raw moxie. He treats crime like a set list—each job a different song, each escape a new encore.

moves.name: Afraid - Sonata of Sneakiness
moves.summary: He plays a slinking melody and vanishes between panels. The Thief repositions out of the spotlight and splits the team: either let him advance a plan off-panel (GM advances a clock/complication) or pursue and become separated and exposed until you regroup.

moves.name: Angry - Jackasses' Symphony
moves.summary: He stamps out a furious rhythm that turns bystanders into hazards. –1 Team from the pool as the scene erupts. A popular or loud hero is targeted by the mob; they must de‑escalate or mark Angry or Guilty from the backlash.

moves.name: Guilty - Power Ballad
moves.summary: He plays a heartfelt ballad to the hero he wronged. Target chooses: accept —clear 1 condition and the Thief takes Influence over you and pockets a small memento from you; or refuse —mark Angry but take +1 forward against him for the rest of the scene.

moves.name: Hopeless - Dirge of Dreadfulness
moves.summary: A crushing refrain blankets the scene. Until someone sparks hope (a bold rally, a meaningful Comfort & Support, or a daring stunt), everyone acts under a fog of doubt (GM makes their mistakes louder). If no one cuts through the dirge by the end of the next round, the Thief exits the scene .

moves.name: Insecure - One-Man Cadenza
moves.summary: Overcompensating, he unleashes a showy solo that reintroduces a complication the team thought they’d handled (a hazard, a goon, or a locked exit), now remixed. If the brought‑back villain returns, they arrive with at least 3 conditions already marked.

moves.name: Steal the Spotlight
moves.summary: With a glittery flourish and a blare of reeds, he yanks the panel border toward himself. He reframes the scene : either he completes a theft off‑panel (the GM removes or compromises a valuable asset) or a hero chases and becomes separated until they fight their way back into frame.

moves.name: Dissonant Riff
moves.summary: A skirling, off‑key run that scrambles nerves and radios alike. The Thief sows confusion : communication is garbled, coordination falters, and one hero of the GM’s choice must either mark a condition or abandon a plan to keep their cool.

moves.name: Polka of Plenty
moves.summary: A shower of coin‑confetti and stolen swag rains down. Civilians stampede for the loot , creating living cover for the Thief and putting innocents in danger unless someone peels off to rescue them.

npcs.name: Disco Bandit
npcs.drive: Steal the spotlight, leave with the loot, and make it look easy.
npcs.abilities: Mirrorball pyrotechnics ("Disco Inferno"), infectious rhythm control ("Disco Fever"), terror choreography ("Tango of Terror"), hyper-kinetic 70s kung fu ("Kung Fu Hustler"), sleight-of-hand and misdirection worthy of a master thief.
npcs.notesSummary: A mirrorball marauder who lives by one rule: Moxie beats muscle. The Disco Bandit sashays into trouble, turns danger into choreography, and exits stage left with everyone’s wallets—and hearts—missing a beat. Inspirations include a catalog of infamous dance-fight techniques like Flashy Dancer, Disco Inferno, Disco Fever, Tango of Terror, and Kung Fu Hustler. :contentReference[oaicite:0]{index=0}

moves.name: Flashy Dancer
moves.summary:
- Separate a hero from their allies.
- Take Influence over a dazzled hero, or they mark a condition .
- Avoid the next blow as it becomes part of the routine.
- Draw cameras and onlookers; if no one manages the crowd this round, someone marks a condition . If a hero narrates equally flashy counter-dance, they take +1 forward against him.
Mirrorball footwork dazzles the scene.

moves.name: Disco Inferno
moves.summary:
With a clap, the dancefloor erupts in hot, mirrored flame.
Create three burning zones and put innocents in danger . Any hero who doesn't help contain the blaze by the end of the round marks Afraid .

moves.name: Disco Fever
moves.summary:
An infectious groove worms into everyone's head.
Each hero chooses: mark a condition for resisting the beat, or let the Bandit take Influence over them.
Until someone silences the music or changes the mood, the Bandit has +1 ongoing .

moves.name: Tango of Terror
moves.summary:
He seizes a partner and begins a macabre tango.
Target hero chooses: mark a condition and break free now, or be swept into a worse position (split from the team). If they aren't rescued by next round, they mark 2 conditions .

moves.name: Kung Fu Hustler
moves.summary:
He fights bare-handed with 1970s movie martial arts.
Disarm a hero—disable or seize a signature weapon/technique for the scene—or turn their move back on them , redirecting an attack into collateral. Then show the costs of collateral damage .

moves.name: Afraid — Stayin' Alive
moves.summary:
He retreats behind a writhing conga line of bystanders.
Put innocents in danger. To pursue, a hero either lets the Bandit take Influence (hesitation) or marks Guilty for risking bystanders.

moves.name: Angry — Boogie Beatdown
moves.summary:
He loses his cool and smashes something important—a monument, stage rigging, or a hero’s asset.
–1 Team as tempers flare. The loudest hero chooses to stand down and take a condition , or confront him at disadvantage .

moves.name: Guilty — Make It Right (Remix)
moves.summary:
His bravado cracks; he throws stolen loot back with a flourish and a breathless apology.
Give the heroes a clear opening—their next action against him gets +1 forward . If they accept his apology, he clears 1 condition and gains Influence over the one who accepted.

moves.name: Hopeless — Last Dance
moves.summary:
He tries to end the party.
Unless a hero Directly Engages him before his next turn, he escapes the scene . If stopped, he stays but marks a condition .

moves.name: Insecure — Mirrorball Posturing
moves.summary:
Overcompensating, he floods the area with strobes and smoke, remixing old tricks.
Bring back one previously cleared minor hazard or mook . Also, target a hero to mark Insecure unless they seize the spotlight right now with a bold success.

npcs.name: Fiddle Fiends
npcs.drive: Be seen by Arpeggio, protect their fave at all costs, and turn every battle into a pop-up concert … even if it endangers everyone.

moves.name: Mosh Pit
moves.summary: The swarm of groupies surges, knocking heroes prone . Anyone not helping with crowd control marks Afraid or Hopeless .

moves.name: Riding his coat tails
moves.summary: The crowd buffs Arpeggio with adoring focus that overshadows the rest of the team; someone else marks Insecure unless they steal the spotlight or coordinate a duet.

moves.name: But first... let me take a selfie
moves.summary: Phones are everywhere as the groupies take a barrage of selfies, capturing some of our heroes in the frame. Targetted heroes mark Insecure and risk a complication related to their playbook if they are living a double life.

moves.name: Angry — Fan Fury
moves.summary: Say it isn't true! Throw a water bottle at the most popular hero in the encounter. The target chooses: de-escalate with honesty or mark Guilty / Angry from the backlash.

moves.name: Afraid — Stampede
moves.summary: Panic ripples; the swarm splits into dangerous currents through traffic, knocking over innocent bystanders who aren't a part of that scene. Endanger civilians unless somebody rescues them.

moves.name: Insecure — Seek Validation
moves.summary: The crowd begs for reassurance from their target, and if they don't receive it they turn on them with snark, inflicting Insecure.

moves.name: Hopeless — Encore!
moves.summary: They demand one big moment—song snippet, daring stunt, heartfelt talk. A hero must appease the crowd, or risk marking Afraid on the other heroes.

moves.name: Guilty - Mistakes Were Made
moves.summary: The groupies apologize profusely, and in a moment of clarity aid the heroes however they can with their turn.

npcs.name: Pastamancer
npcs.drive: Prove that pasta is the underlying structure of reality ; enthrone the Pastalords; and remake Halcyon City into a sanctum‑kitchen where all obey the arcane laws of noodlecraft.
npcs.abilities:
- Arcane noodlecraft (summon, animate, and weaponize pasta)
- Elemental sauces (hot, cold, stench, spooky, sleaze) that flavor and alter effects
- Wards, bindings, and edible constructs (cocoons, bandages, leashes)
- Pasta thralls and utensil-channeling staves
npcs.notesSummary: Lean into spectacle and collateral — scalding steam, slippery noodles, bursting ravioli. Separate the team, bind the bold, and make them choose between rescuing innocents and pressing the Pastamancer . When he marks conditions, he gets weirder , not weaker.

moves.name: Afraid - Tolerance of the Kitchen
moves.summary: Heat‑wards flare and steam billows; the kitchen becomes a maze of scalding curtains. Until someone vents or cools the ward, the next attempt to directly engage him is under pressure— shift the result down by 1 or the attacker marks Afraid to push through. Show how the scalding environment endangers civilians .

moves.name: Angry - Al Dente Inferno
moves.summary: He boils over—oil flashes, pans slam, and sauce ignites. –1 Team from the chaos. Target the loudest mask: they choose— mark a condtion to stand their ground through the scalding blast, or give him an opening as they dive for cover (he immediately repositions or isolates someone).

moves.name: Guilty - Lasagna Bandages
moves.summary: A pang of conscience—he conjures warm, enchanted lasagna strips to bind wounds. Choose one: revive a fallen minion (return them to the scene), or offer a bandage to a hero . If they accept, clear 1 condition and he gains Influence over them; if they refuse, he marks a new condition from the sting of rejection.

moves.name: Hopeless - Stuffed Mortar Shell
moves.summary: He lobs a ticking, overstuffed mortar shell that bursts next panel . Unless a hero spends their next action to contain or redirect it, it detonates , wrecking the set and he exits the scene in 2 turns under cover of chaos. If stopped, he remains but marks a condition .

moves.name: Insecure - Cannelloni Cocoon
moves.summary: He seals himself inside a steaming cannelloni bunker. Until it’s cracked, redirect hits against him to the Cocoon . A hero can Focus Fire (give ground) to break it now, or work to pry it apart over time—meanwhile, he summons a pasta thrall or repositions with noodle‑tendrils.

moves.name: Cannelloni Cannon
moves.summary: The Pastamancer conjures a gleaming cannon of stuffed cannelloni and fires a sauce‑flavored blast (hot, cold, stench, spooky, or sleaze). The shockwave shreds cover, scatters the team, and leaves slick, steaming debris. Use it to separate them , remove an asset , or put bystanders in danger .

moves.name: Spaghetti Spear
moves.summary: A razor‑straight dart of uncooked spaghetti whistles through the panel. Pin a hero to scenery by cape/sleeve, impale a key gadget , or force them to mark a condition to break free in the moment.

moves.name: Ravioli Shurikens
moves.summary: He flicks a handful of stuffed ravioli like throwing stars— up to three nearby targets feel the bite of different elements. Tag multiple heroes, inflict split conditions across the team, or destroy delicate tech with a sticky, sizzling hit.

moves.name: Entangling Noodles
moves.summary:
Nobody asked him to send noods.
A wad of sticky noodles erupts and whips around a target. Take away their mobility or their weapon ; force teamwork to pry them free, or compel a hero to give ground to keep someone else from being ensnared.

moves.name: Afraid - Elemental Saucesphere
moves.summary: He turtles up inside a shimmering Elemental Saucesphere (hot/cold/stench). To reach him, someone must brave the elements or puncture it with vulnerability or truth. If ignored, he buys time to reposition, call for backup, or start brewing something worse.

moves.name: Angry - Boiling Point
moves.summary: His simmer boils over. He slams a saucepan and splatters the closest symbol of the team’s pride; –1 Team from the pool. Target 1 hero: they must defuse him with honesty or a daring success that changes the room’s mood, or they mark Angry/Guilty from the humiliation.

moves.name: Guilty - Clean the Mess
moves.summary: He rushes to clean the mess —stabilizing an injured bystander with Saucy Salve or mending what he broke. He offers a vulnerable apology to a hero. If they accept, clear 1 of his conditions and give that hero an immediate chance to exercise Influence over him; if they refuse, he doubles down later, colder.

moves.name: Hopeless - Thousand Islands Exile
moves.summary: He tries to banish himself or a foe to the labyrinth of the Thousand Islands, slipping between panels. Unless a hero Directly Engages or otherwise interrupts within the next 2 turns, the target exits the scene . If intercepted, he stays—and marks a condition .

moves.name: Insecure - Reheated Leftovers
moves.summary: Overcompensating, he reheats a resolved complication . Bring back one hazard, liability, or rival the heroes thought they removed. If a villain is brought back, they return with at least 3 conditions marked.

moves.name: Curse of the Weaksauce
moves.summary: He splashes a thin, clinging glaze that saps strength and confidence . 1 hero takes a powerful blow. If they fail, their big move becomes precarious and messy - mark a condition and create a complication.

moves.name: Saucestorm
moves.summary: A roiling storm of scalding and freezing sauces tears through the panel. Everyone immediately chooses: push through and mark a condition , or scramble for cover and give up a position, asset, or innocent.

moves.name: Curse of the Marinara
moves.summary: Tendrils of writhing marinara lash from within the target, binding and siphoning . While the curse lingers this scene, whenever any hero marks a condition , Sauceror clears a condition or immediately makes another Villain Move as the sauce surges with stolen resolve.

moves.name: Soul Saucery
moves.summary: He condenses ambient emotion into a boiling soul-bubble . Trap a bystander or isolated hero in thick, glowing sauce—separating them from the team. While the bubble holds, Sauceror feeds on the team’s anxiety : the first time they hesitate or argue on-screen, he takes another Villain Move .

moves.summary: @UUID[Compendium.masks-newgeneration-unofficial.documents.llXD7GIZiU5z5MiG.JournalEntryPage.WDtPMAeq3CIumtrg]{Bring an NPC to Rash Decisions and Hard Conclusions}

moves.name: Afraid - Hibernate
moves.summary: She drops into a defensive curl, eyes shut, breath steaming— hibernation . Unless a hero engages him in the next 2 turns, she exits the scene . If woken or cornered, she stays but marks a condition from the jolt; if left alone, she clears 1 condition and returns with chilling calm.

moves.name: Angry - Cavalcade of Fury
moves.summary: She bellows and launches a parade of crushing blows, hitting multiple targets across the scene , smashing environments and causing collateral damage . The team may spend 1 Team, describing coordinated counters, to reduce collateral or to pull one target out of danger .

moves.name: Guilty - Tongue of the Walrus
moves.summary:
If the hero accepts, they may exercise Influence immediately; if they rebuff him, she hardens her heart and gains +1 on their next action .
A rare, awkward pause. She licks his wounds and mutters that this was supposed to be a fair smackdown . She clears 1 condition and offers one hero a concession (drop a grudge, release a hostage, or give an opening).

moves.name: Hopeless - Northern Exposure
moves.summary: She exhales a howling arctic blast that turns the battlefield into black ice and stinging sleet. Introduce a new environmental hazard (slick footing, freezing fog, brittle structures). If the heroes do not address it, inflict a condition on 2 random heroes as the scene becomes hazardous; if they counter it, she stays but marks a condition .

moves.name: Insecure - Pride of the Puffin
moves.summary:
Overcompensating, she grandstands, flexing and roaring about her legend. She reintroduces a complication the heroes thought they handled (a hazard, a rival bruiser, or a PR mess).
If that complication was a villain, they return with at least 3 conditions marked and a chip on their shoulder.

moves.name: Batter Up!
moves.summary: With a savage home-run swing, she banishes a hero off-panel —over rooftops, into the harbor, or down a subway tunnel in a bold move that causes collateral damage .

moves.name: Northern Explosion
moves.summary: She unleashes an arctic shockwave that flash-freezes surfaces. Create an ice-slick danger zone (movement is risky; flying debris; freezing mists). Heroes who stand their ground in the blast risk marking a condition unless they demonstrate unshakable resolve or creative cover.

moves.name: Blubber Up
moves.summary: She slicks her skin with impossible blubber-armor . Grapples and holds slide off; brute force ricochets into scenery. Reduce or redirect the next hard hit into collateral damage (cracked pillars, fallen signs), creating new threats for the heroes to contend with.

moves.name: Furious Wallop
moves.summary:
- Split the party (hurl a hero across zones or rooftops)
- Smash their cover (remove an advantage/asset)
- Ring their bell (mark a Condition).
She channels a gallon of rage into a precise, crushing blow. Choose how you react to the blow:

moves.name: Per My Last Email…
moves.summary:
Sharon produces a policy, memo, or contract addendum that redefines the stakes mid-scene.
On a hit, she reframes the heroes’ recent actions as policy violations, shifting the spotlight to her authority and forcing her target to act under scrutiny (shift result down -1) or mark a fitting Condition .

moves.name: Mandatory 1:1
moves.summary: She isolates a hero for a “quick chat,” splitting the party and leveraging her Influence. If the hero engages, she offers a superficially reasonable deal that costs time, reputation, or autonomy ; if they refuse, escalate to security and trigger a PR backlash that inflicts a condition on a random Hero.

moves.name: Performance Improvement Plan
moves.summary: Sharon formalizes her “areas of concern” and performs a pass/fail audit of her target's next action. While the PIP is active, their mistakes are louder and stickier ; clearing it requires a meaningful demonstration that risks collateral drama or burns a bridge. Shift the result of the target's next action down by 2.

moves.name: Afraid - Safety First
moves.summary: She slams the big red Risk Mitigation button: lockdowns, curfews, and incident tape bloom across the scene. Civilians and heroes alike are ushered away from a target area.

moves.name: Angry - Provide Feedback
moves.summary: Karen lashes out with "feedback" , publicly dressing down the loudest mask. She inflicts Insecure or Guilty (GM’s choice) on someone who bites, unless they counter with honest vulnerability or a daring success that changes the room’s mood.

moves.name: Guilty - "Circle Back"
moves.summary: Her veneer cracks; she offers a soft reconciliation —coaching, trainings, even resources— but with strings attached . If the team accepts, gain an opening or asset; if they refuse, she doubles down later with a cleaner, colder policy strike.

moves.name: Hopeless - "Let's punt on that"
moves.summary: Karen punts responsibility to The Board / A.E.G.I.S. / Legal , summoning heavier adult attention. The scene levels up : introduce a higher-tier foe, impossible deadline, or reputation clock—yet also seed one concrete way the teens can out-maneuver the bureaucracy . Failure to rise to the challenge will lead to Inflicting Hopeless on 2 random heroes.

moves.name: Insecure - "Add some color"
moves.summary: Overcompensating, Sharon attempts to reframe the narrative. Cameras make every choice count; PCs can seize the mic to flip public sentiment or watch Karen curate their story into a neat, demoralizing headline that inflicts Guilty on a target of her choosing.

moves.summary: @UUID[Compendium.masks-newgeneration-unofficial.documents.llXD7GIZiU5z5MiG.JournalEntryPage.WDtPMAeq3CIumtrg]{Bring an NPC to Rash Decisions and Hard Conclusions}

moves.name: Afraid - Take 5
moves.summary:
He calls for a break on-set… and this alters the flow of our comic, too.
Everybody immediately takes an involuntary 5 minute break.

moves.name: Angry - You're Fired
moves.summary:
He fires the nearest PA—then you. –1 Team from the pool.
Target 1 hero : if he has Influence over them, they lose Influence over him (you’re off the project); if not, they mark a condition from the humiliation.

moves.name: Guilty - Embellish Filmography
moves.summary:
He shamelessly polishes his Wikipedia page. Doesn't even bother to do it anonymously.
He takes +1 on his next action and loudly apologizes to a hero. If the hero accepts the apology, clear 1 condition but also allow them to exercise influence immediately.

moves.name: Hopeless - Delete IMDB Entries
moves.summary: He attempts to vanish from the narrative. Unless a hero Directly Engages him in the next 2 turns, he exits the scene (escapes). If caught, he stays but marks a condition .

moves.name: Insecure - Director’s Cut
moves.summary: He re‑edits in a previously resolved complication. Bring back one hazard or liability the heroes thought they removed. If a villain is brought back, they return to set with at least 3 conditions marked.

moves.name: Cut!
moves.summary:
He points at the last hero action that changed something :
“We’re doing another take.”
Choice: Keep the original result but mark 2 conditions , or play a basic move with -2 forward from the pressure of re-shooting.
If you succeed in the re-shoot, +1 team .

moves.name: And... action!
moves.summary: All other enemies in the scene that have not taken their turn yet take an extra Villain Move right now.

moves.name: Inspired by Quentin Tarantino
moves.summary:
He declares that this film - or comic - is heavily inspired by Quentin Tarantino. This violence is shocking to our teen heroes, who must each mark a condition .
During the next round, sharing a GIF in Discord that corresponds with your move is rewarded with +1 forward .
OR
Describe your stylish footwork in the execution of your move for a +1 forward and +1 ongoing towards that roll.

npcs.name: The Professional
npcs.notesSummary: Suave, immaculately tailored charcoal suit with a subtle pocket square. Close-cropped hair, watch that costs more than a hovercycle, and a super-serious “don’t waste my time” expression. Calm voice, colder eyes. Azlan is Halcyon’s most discreet problem-solver for people with too much money and too many secrets—he fixes things by finding leverage, not volume.

moves.name: Afraid - Lockdown
moves.summary: Security shutters drop; fire doors seal; elevators freeze. Trap the team between civilians and hazards and prompt a reaction; anyone who reacts without a plan marks a condition or causes @UUID[Compendium.masks-newgeneration-unofficial.documents.llXD7GIZiU5z5MiG.JournalEntryPage.y38zWkHIGzqyZmGc]{Collateral Damage}.

moves.name: Angry - Make an Example
moves.summary: He publicly punishes a liability (a lieutenant, a corrupt official, a captured hero’s contact). Inflict a Condition on the most defiant hero, or take something from them (evidence, position, footing) right now.

moves.name: Guilty - Offer Charity
moves.summary: He tries to launder the conscience: emergency donations, medical bills paid, a public apology that helps the wrong people. Offer a clear opening (add +1 forward to pierce his mask or expose the ruse), but if the team spurns it, shift public sentiment against them.

moves.name: Hopeless - Burn the Evidence
moves.summary: He torches everything: servers, shell companies, and safehouses. @UUID[Compendium.masks-newgeneration-unofficial.documents.llXD7GIZiU5z5MiG.JournalEntryPage.y38zWkHIGzqyZmGc]{Show the Costs of Collateral Damage} and @UUID[Compendium.masks-newgeneration-unofficial.documents.llXD7GIZiU5z5MiG.JournalEntryPage.J6NDHhQ2xeaHUZ6Y]{endanger civilians} in the blast radius. The team can save people or secure the proof— not both without splitting or paying a heavy price.

moves.name: Insecure - Reckless Counter
moves.summary: He overreaches—experimental gear, a mercenary ace, or an ill-advised stunt. @UUID[Compendium.masks-newgeneration-unofficial.documents.llXD7GIZiU5z5MiG.JournalEntryPage.EgNc30M2opeJiQOg]{Turn the Hero's Last Move Back on Them} (Azlan counters the team’s last tactic), but leave a visible flaw the heroes can exploit for +1 forward if they call it out in the fiction.

moves.name: Show the Receipts
moves.summary: He produces irrefutable leverage (documents, footage, bank trails) and @UUID[Compendium.masks-newgeneration-unofficial.documents.llXD7GIZiU5z5MiG.JournalEntryPage.vbmelu6amDCsv8Xp]{Tell Them Who They Are or Who They Should Be} . The target either accepts the Label shift or marks a condition ; if they try to reject and flub it, Azlan @UUID[Compendium.masks-newgeneration-unofficial.documents.llXD7GIZiU5z5MiG.JournalEntryPage.NQfxjpOmX5mqu1Ow]{Takes Influence} and makes another move.

moves.name: Underworld Connections
moves.summary:
Follow up by demanding the team split their focus.
He gestures; new villains appear. Separate a hero from the team or @UUID[Compendium.masks-newgeneration-unofficial.documents.llXD7GIZiU5z5MiG.JournalEntryPage.J6NDHhQ2xeaHUZ6Y]{Put Innocents in Danger} under crisp, choreographed pressure.

moves.name: Offer You (probably) Can't Refuse
moves.summary:
He offers a “reasonable” deal: freedom for a hostage, data for a promise, safe exit for a concession.
If the team refuses, @UUID[Compendium.masks-newgeneration-unofficial.documents.llXD7GIZiU5z5MiG.JournalEntryPage.89UPbdTtpbs4kmP3]{Pay a Price} (burn goodwill, lose an asset, invite adult attention). If they accept, @UUID[Compendium.masks-newgeneration-unofficial.documents.w5RMQhyRMu0Kz8Bh.JournalEntryPage.AGsdZxeDIixx5ulh]{Create an opportunity for your allies} —with strings attached.

moves.name: Getaway Plan
moves.summary: He vanishes into mirrored glass and motorcade shadows. @UUID[Compendium.masks-newgeneration-unofficial.documents.llXD7GIZiU5z5MiG.JournalEntryPage.sSBCr0W3EJYs6Tg7]{Announce Between-Panel Threats} (he relocates the op, scrubs servers, moves the money), or escape unless someone commits immediately to directly engage or unleash their powers with -1 forward .

moves.name: Afraid - Scope Creep
moves.summary: He adds two fresh “must‑do” sticky notes to the scene (new complication/clock or two simultaneous fires). If the team ignores both until the end of the round, they all mark a condition.

moves.name: Angry - Demand Velocity
moves.summary:
Scrumlord barks “We need to go faster!”
The next hero gets +1 to their next roll .
The next villain acts twice back-to-back .

moves.name: Guilty - Team Retro
moves.summary:
Each hero is compelled to say something thing their character could’ve done better during this encounter ; for each who does, shift Mundane +1, Superior –1 . Anyone who refuses marks a condition .
If at least 2 heroes contribute, add Team +1.

moves.name: Hopeless - Blame Team
moves.summary: Scrumlord clears 2 of his own conditions by publicly blaming his allied villains , who each mark a condition .

moves.name: Insecure - Pull Metrics
moves.summary: He brandishes a table of analytics that disparages a specific hero . If he doesn’t already have Influence over them, he gains it. If he does , that hero marks a condition and the team loses 1 Team .

moves.name: Mandatory Stand-Up
moves.summary:
Scrumlord points to one hero: “Report on your activities and whereabouts in the past week.” Target: One hero.
Choice: Give a brief one sentence update or mark a condition . If you provide an update that is longer than directed, mark 2 conditions.
Post-Action : If the Scrumlord has influence, they will attempt to exercise it .

moves.name: Blocker Tag
moves.summary:
He slaps a neon “BLOCKER” sticker on a hero’s chest. Target: One hero.
Choice: Mark a condition now and take your action immediately with –2 (you push through the blocker), or skip your next chance to act and the blocker falls off at the end of that skip.
Any ally can spend 1 Team at any time to yank the blocker off that hero.

moves.name: Change Sprint Goal
moves.summary: He rewrites the objective board and compels the heroes to participate in these new activities. Gain influence over all heroes . The next hero that attempts to continue pursuing their original goal will be subject to this influence before they can resolve their action.

npcs.name: Turtle Tamer
npcs.drive: Prove that slow and steady wins. Reclaim the waterfront for the Great Turtle Spirits. Humble rash, flashy heroes.
npcs.abilities: Mystic shellcraft; spectral terrapin invocations; superhuman durability; gravity-slowing auras; shield mastery and improvised bucklers.
npcs.notesSummary: Keeper of ancient terrapin rites. Champions patience, resilience, and the long view—at any cost.

moves.summary: @UUID[Compendium.masks-newgeneration-unofficial.documents.JournalEntry.llXD7GIZiU5z5MiG.JournalEntryPage.voNk2PNNF7oNqnSn]{Make a Playbook Move}

moves.summary: @UUID[Compendium.masks-newgeneration-unofficial.documents.llXD7GIZiU5z5MiG.JournalEntryPage.WDtPMAeq3CIumtrg]{Bring an NPC to Rash Decisions and Hard Conclusions}

moves.name: Afraid - Into the Shell
moves.summary:
He retreats beneath a shimmering terrapin dome that divides the field.
Split the party by sealing off a lane or rooftop and endanger civilians outside unless someone holds the barrier open. Anyone pursuing him into the dome must mark Afraid or expose themselves to a hard move from the environment (falling masonry, rising tide).

moves.name: Angry - Snapping Point
moves.summary:
With a guttural bark, he surges forward like a snapping turtle.
–1 Team from the pool as he shatters formation. Target 1 hero : they choose— stand their ground and mark Angry as his shield slams into them, or give ground and let him break something important (cover, gear, or a relationship stake).

moves.name: Guilty - Return the Hatchling
moves.summary:
His conscience twinges; he rescues a terrified turtle—or a civilian—before the crush.
He takes +1 on his next action and offers an olive branch to a hero. If the hero accepts the moment of grace, clear 1 of his conditions but give that hero a chance to exercise Influence immediately (shift his Labels, demand a promise, or press for surrender). If refused, he inflicts Guilty on someone who witnesses the rejection.

moves.name: Hopeless - The Long View
moves.summary:
He settles into a waiting stance—the tortoise outlasting the hare.
Unless a hero Directly Engages him within the next two turns, he exits the scene (escapes along the riverfront or into storm drains). If caught, he remains but marks a condition from the effort.

moves.name: Insecure - Reinforce the Shell
moves.summary:
Overcompensating, he rebuilds a problem the heroes solved.
Bring back one hazard or liability the team removed—rising floodwater, gridlocked traffic, or a stampede of panicked turtles. If a defeated minion returns, they come back with at least 3 conditions marked.

moves.name: Shell Up
moves.summary:
The Turtle Tamer crouches; a translucent tortoise carapace blooms and turns force back on the reckless .
Anyone who rushes him this round must either back off and give him time and positioning (he repositions and removes one complication on him) or press in and mark Angry as the shell bristles and absorbs the blow. Creative or ranged approaches can earn the team +1 Team if they reframe the exchange on-panel.

moves.name: Patience of the Tortoise
moves.summary:
He draws everyone into his pace . The fight drags —panel borders widen; word balloons stretch.
Until a hero spends a panel establishing a clever workaround or team rhythm, basic moves that lean on speed or initiative suffer –1 , and the GM advances any countdown tied to flooding, traffic, or public panic.

moves.name: Blessing of the War Snapper
moves.summary:
He slams a carved totem; spectral jaws clack like thunder .
Choose the boldest hero : they must give ground (the team loses 1 Team and he splits the party or claims key cover) or stand firm and mark Angry . Either way, he shreds a piece of cover or an asset in the scene.

npcs.name: Vermissian Lite
npcs.drive: Seeks revenge against Casshan, blaming him for maintenance and psychogical issues alike.
npcs.abilities: A horrifying cut-rate knight with a chip on his armor/shoulder. The Knight Lite buys knockoff gear from shady storefronts and talks a big game on his Twitch stream.

moves.name: Angry — You're the hater
moves.summary: They rant about the heroes being “haters”. The most outspoken hero in this session marks Guilty or Insecure unless they offer some sort of verbal validation to Lite.

moves.name: Afraid — Refund Run
moves.summary: They flee to “get backup,” forcing a chase and potentially knocking over civilians along the way.

moves.name: Insecure — Cancel Culture
moves.summary: They blame their issues and reputation issues on "Cancel Culture", dismissing their insecurities with no consequences.

moves.name: Guilty — Save Face
moves.summary: They try to fix everything at once, giving the team a free shot to end combat with him if they help Lite save face.

moves.name: Hopeless — Sell-out
moves.summary: They accept a sponsorship offer from a rival of AEGIS, undermining the PR for the team. The most popular hero in this encounter marks Guilty .

moves.name: Gadgets from Temu.com
moves.summary: Whips out a tool that works once then explodes/fizzles, creating a new hazard and forcing a nearby hero to mark Afraid .

moves.name: Flash Sale
moves.summary: Distracts with promos and shout-outs for his Twitch channel. Anyone chasing the bit risks marking Insecure when it flops.

moves.name: Recall Notice
moves.summary: Crucial gear malfunctions and explodes , dealing a powerful blow against multiple heroes, at the cost of inflicting 2 conditions to himself.

npcs.name: Vermissian Night
npcs.drive: Motivation: Prove the team (especially Casshan) is a risk the city can’t afford—then replace them with a stricter order.
npcs.abilities: He’s not evil per-se; he’s convinced that only the strictest status quo can save humahnity. Master of booby traps and calculated public shaming.

moves.name: Cut the Lights
moves.summary: He cuts power or vantage, separating a hero into darkness. If they don’t immediately rejoin the team, mark Afraid or stumble into a prepared trap.

moves.name: #Doxxed
moves.summary: He unveils pre-gathered intel that reframes a Hero's past mistakes . Shift their labels, then the hero must defend their image or mark Guilty .

moves.name: One Step Ahead
moves.summary: The team gains an opening to attack with forward advantage (shift up), but at a cost. The next hero to attack this villain will be met with the perfect gadget or contingency plan, and will defend at a severe disadvantage (shift 2 down)

moves.name: Angry - Intimidate
moves.summary: He presses hard and loud, cornering the most impulsive hero. Anyone who meets him head-on risks marking Afraid or Insecure from the sheer pressure.

moves.name: Afraid — Lights Out
moves.summary: He refuses to engage directly, plunging into stealth, and assaults the weakest link ; someone not actively protected marks Afraid .

moves.name: Insecure — Over-Explains the Plan
moves.summary: He monologues, inviting a hero to provoke or pierce . On a hit, create a flaw in his setup; on a miss, he flips it to shift their Labels or inflict Guilty .

moves.name: Guilty — Hesitation
moves.summary: He hesitates when civilians are in danger; the team gains a clean chance to rescue or regroup , but he vows to show no mercy in the future.

moves.name: Hopeless - Midnight Hotline
moves.summary: He makes a phone call to an outside source with inside knowledge about a party member. The outside source responds affirmatively. At a much later date, the team may face retribution from that outside source.

npcs.name: Vermissian Wight
npcs.drive: Seeks revenge against Casshan, blaming him for maintenance and psychogical issues alike.
npcs.abilities: A horrifying cut-rate knight with a chip on his armor/shoulder. The Knight Lite buys knockoff gear from shady storefronts and talks a big game on his Twitch stream.

moves.name: Angry — Rattle the Bones
moves.summary: The Wight destroys nearby landmarks and sculptures in a fit of rage. Nearby heroes mark Angry or Afraid .

moves.name: Afraid — Refund Run
moves.summary: They flee to “get backup,” forcing a chase and potentially knocking over civilians along the way.

moves.name: Insecure — Cancel Culture
moves.summary: They blame their issues and reputation issues on "Cancel Culture", dismissing their insecurities with no consequences.

moves.name: Guilty — Save Face
moves.summary: They try to fix everything at once, giving the team a free shot to end combat with him if they help Lite save face.

moves.name: Hopeless — Sell-out
moves.summary: They accept a sponsorship offer from a rival of AEGIS, undermining the PR for the team. The most popular hero in this encounter marks Guilty .

moves.name: Chill of the Grave
moves.summary: A bone-cold wave forces everyone to confront failure; mark Hopeless unless you can declare a unique reason why you believe your team will win this fight.

moves.name: Deathless Advance
moves.summary: He ignores blows and closes the distance , separating someone from the team or their safety net and dealing a powerful blow.

moves.name: Memento Mori
moves.summary: He foretells a personal doom; the targeted PC chooses: accept a Label shift to avoid it now or refuse and face a dire complication connected to your playbook .

journals.name: House Rules
journals.summary:
- Players with Influence over a Companion may act as that companion .
- This includes roleplay and narrative control!
- Play is not limited to a single player.
- Companion labels are locked and do not shift.
- Companion moves are situational and weaker than heroes .
